connector.description: Receive data from Kafka topics on an insecure broker.

camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.t.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.topic
camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.t.description: Comma separated list of Kafka topic names

camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.b.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.bootstrapServers
camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.b.description: Comma separated list of Kafka Broker URLs

camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.a.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.autoCommitEnable
camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.a.description: If true, periodically commit to ZooKeeper the offset of messages already fetched by the consumer

camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.a.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.allowManualCommit
camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.a.description: Whether to allow doing manual commits

camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.p.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.pollOnError
camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.p.description: What to do if kafka threw an exception while polling for new messages. There are 5 enums and the value can be one of DISCARD, ERROR_HANDLER, RECONNECT, RETRY, STOP

camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.a.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.autoOffsetReset
camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.a.description: What to do when there is no initial offset. There are 3 enums and the value can be one of latest, earliest, none

camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.c.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.consumerGroup
camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.c.description: A string that uniquely identifies the group of consumers to which this source belongs Example: my-group-id

camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.d.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.deserializeHeaders
camel.kamelet.kafka-not-secured-source.d.description: When enabled the Kamelet source will deserialize all message headers to String representation.
